author: kj005
title: 阅瞳科技亮相国家级近视防控盛会，以"自然光科技"助力教育体系建设_中华网
text:
在近日举行的中国智慧工程研究会近视防控教育工作委员会学术委员会成立大会上，健康光环境标准制定者阅瞳（Yettooh）携全光谱护眼技术深度参与。作为《儿童青少年家具健康光环境照明设计规范》起草单位，阅瞳的“自然光科技”与大会倡导的“坐姿-光照协同防控”理念高度契合，为覆盖2000万青少年的国家近视防控网络注入创新动能。
国家级学术平台启航，构建科学防控新体系
2025年3月30日，中国智慧工程研究会近视防控教育工作委员会学术委员会在北京正式成立。这一由国家教育部主管、民政部注册的国家级学术平台，汇聚了 48位顶尖眼科专家 ，包括主任委员郑广瑛教授及王宁利、瞿佳、毕宏生等荣誉主委，旨在通过“筛-防-控-治”全链条闭环，破解我国儿童青少年近视率高发难题。
大会聚焦 环境与 行为双因素 干预 ：
科学正姿行动 ：推行“一拳一尺一寸”读写姿势标准，降低脊柱与视力双重负荷；
光环境标准化 ：将阅瞳参与制定的健康光环境设计规范纳入校园及家庭强制应用场景，从源头消除频闪、蓝光等视觉健康威胁；
政- 医 -校-家-社协同 ：依托郑广瑛教授提出的五维联动模式，构建大数据驱动的近视防控生态。
阅 瞳 技术方案：为科学防控提供硬核支撑
作为广东省照明学会成员及行业标准制定者，阅瞳护眼大路灯凭借 三重核心技术 成为大会推荐的光环境优化方案：
1.类日光全光谱技术 光谱连续性逼近自然太阳光，显色指数达 Ra98 ，解决传统LED光源色彩失真导致的睫状肌过度调节问题，从根源减轻视疲劳。
2.零危害光源架构 硬件级RG0蓝光豁免+真无频闪设计，通过中国眼谷严苛生物安全性测评，为儿童青少年提供“隐形护盾”。
3. 动态场景适配 20-100%无级调光+4000K黄金色温，精准匹配阅读、网课、绘画等多场景需求，避免过强/过暗光照诱发近视风险。
专家背书 ：瞿佳教授在会议中指出：“防控近视需从环境改造入手，阅瞳类日光技术对降低教室照明频闪危害具有示范意义。
产学研深度融合：从标准到落地的闭环实践
阅瞳正以技术协同推动防控体系落地：
产品生态联动 ：护眼大路灯与人体工学学习桌形成“光照+坐姿”双防护系统，直击教育部认定的两大近视诱因；
公益行动赋能 ：联合委员会启动“校园光环境改造计划”，向资源薄弱地区捐赠护眼设备，践行“光明大使”责任；
临床数据验证 ：借力中国眼谷十家眼科医院网络，开展长期光照质量与近视进展相关性研究，为行业提供循证依据。
行业启示：护眼照明进入科学认证时代
本次大会释放明确信号：护眼产品已从“营销概念”转向“临床验证”。中国眼谷正联合华为、京东方等企业制定《眼健康显示产品技术规范》，推动频闪指数、蓝光限值等硬性标准出台。
阅瞳的实践印证了这一趋势——其产品入驻中国眼谷博览中心，与人工视网膜等尖端成果并列展示，标志着国产护眼技术正式跻身国家级健康推广梯队。
以科技之光守护民族未来
当一盏灯被赋予“光明大使”的使命，阅瞳的价值已超越产品本身。在构建覆盖2000万青少年的立体防控网络中，阅瞳以标准制定者的自觉、科技普惠的担当，让“中国智造”成为健康中国的底牌。正如学术委员会主任郑广瑛教授所言：“当防大于治成为全民共识，科技便是照亮亿万家庭未来的那束光。”
阅 瞳 使命 为每一寸空间注入科学设计，为每一次学习守护光明未来 防控倡议 践行“一拳一尺一寸”，选择阅瞳标准健康光环境——让清晰视界触手可及
免责声明：市场有风险，选择需谨慎！此文仅供参考，不作买卖依据。
责任编辑：kj005

author: agenda.visit@turismodeportugal.pt
title: Alentejo Pig Fair
text:
Alentejo Pig Fair
Alentejo Pig Fair
Events
The Alentejo Pig Fair is a mark of identity of the rural world of this region, reflecting the knowledge, flavors and skills of women and men who transform the potential of the land.
In 2025, the XVII edition of the largest event in Ourique, Capital of the Alentejo Pig, returns on the 21st, 22nd and 23rd of March, in an event that promises to be unique and memorable. Celebrate gastronomy, tradition, identity, with lots of musical entertainment and a vibrant spirit of a party that attracts thousands of visitors from the region and the country.

author: Reuters
title: Workers uninjured after tunnel falls down in Los Angeles
text:
The trapped workers were shuttled back to the tunnel’s entry point, more than 8km away from the affected area, after they escaped the collapsed section and met several co-workers in the unaffected part of the tunnel, the Los Angeles fire department said in a statement.
The tunnel, which had a diameter of 5.5m, trapped 27 individuals, while four workers entered the damaged section to assist with rescue, LA fire chief Ronnie Villanueva told reporters in a media briefing.
“The workers had to climb through debris. They had to make themselves out through”, before they were assisted out, Villanueva said.
Robert Ferrante, chief engineer and general manager of Los Angeles county sanitation districts, told the briefing that a section of the already built part of the tunnel experienced squeezing ground conditions and partially collapsed.
“LAFD has just reported that all workers who were trapped in the tunnel in Wilmington are now out and accounted for. I just spoke with many of the workers who were trapped. Thank you to all of our brave first responders who acted immediately,” Los Angeles mayor Karen Bass said in a post on X.
The collapsed section was a part of the Los Angeles County’s Clearwater project, where the new 7-mile tunnel is being built to upgrade the region’s sewer system, officials added.

author: MH
title: Mujer descubre refugio subterráneo de la II Guerra Mundial en su patio
text:
Mujer descubre refugio subterráneo de la II Guerra Mundial en su patio Lapatilla febrero 29 2024, 7:07 pm Posteado en: Curiosidades , Titulares Compártelo: Click to share on WhatsApp (Opens in new window) Click to share on Telegram (Opens in new window) Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Click to share on Twitter (Opens in new window) Click to email a link to a friend (Opens in new window) Click to share on Pinterest (Opens in new window) Click to share on LinkedIn (Opens in new window) Hasta el momento, el video cuenta con más de un millón de visitan dejando impactados a los internautas ante lo bien construido que esta el refugio, vestigio de una época muy oscura para la historia de Europa. Foto: TikTok
Una mamá británica hizo un inesperado descubrimiento en el patio trasero de su casa cuando levanto una piedra que se encontraba en el lugar.
Por: Excélsior
La información que necesitas para comenzar el día ¡Suscríbete gratis! Rebecca Hobson, de 34 años, se encontró con el refugio antiaéreo de 48 metros luego de que sus vecinos le dijeron en 2020 que podría haber algo relacionado con la guerra en su propiedad en Kent, Inglaterra.
@bexh5 A few comments asking to see whats on the other side of the wall at the other end. Here it is. ? #airraidshelters #wartime #history #england #coolplaces #fyp
? Aesthetic Vibes – sxldi
Sin embargo, la joven madre nunca sospecho nada y fue tiempo después cuando descubrió que su patio trasero, fue usado como refugio antibombas sin siquiera sospechar nada durante los 15 años que lleva viviendo en la casa.
Rebecca se dio a la tarea de compartir el impactante descubrimiento en TikTok, en donde mostró cómo luce el refugio actualmente en su jardín y en donde ofrecen un recorrido virtual por lo que parece ser un túnel con luces a través de la cueva.
El video recorre lentamente el pasillo antes de que se encuentren restos de trampas para ratas, botellas y tazones cubiertos de polvo.
@bexh5 Finding an Air raid shelter in our garden. Part 3 – The video tour. We added the lights to save carrying torches. ? #airraidshelters #wartime #history #england #coolplaces #fyp This video is exclusively managed by Kennedy News and Media. To license or use in a commercial player please contact [email protected] .
? Good Times – Bruno Boe
Hasta el momento, el video cuenta con más de un millón de visitan dejando impactados a los internautas ante lo bien construido que esta el refugio, vestigio de una época muy oscura para la historia de Europa.
Para leer más, pulse aquí .

author: , Montgomery Advertiser
title: Erica DuBois impact on Prattville girls basketball senior U'llyriah Lewis
text: From little league to AHSAA Final Four: Erica DuBois impact on Prattville girls basketball senior Prattville girls basketball made school history at the AHSAA semifinals Wednesday, being the first team in program history to make it to back-to-back Final Four appearances. Head coach Erica DuBois played in the final four when she attended Prattville High School 25 years ago. Now coaching her second straight semifinal, she's adamant on returning back to Birmingham and playing for a Blue Map. "I think the girls has done an exceptional job building this program up," DuBois said. "I want to give the kudos to them, I'm extremely proud of this team." Game Story: [Prattville girls basketball eliminated by Hewitt-Trussville in AHSAA Class 7A semifinal](https://www.montgomeryadvertiser.com/story/sports/high-school/girls-basketball/2024/02/29/prattville-lions-defeated-by-hewitt-trussville-in-ahsaa-class-7a-semifinal-alabama-high-school-bball/72712338007/) This year the Lady Lions had one senior in U'llyriah Lewis, and in her final game she finished with 21 points leading the team in scoring. DuBois has coached Lewis since she was in middle school playing recreational basketball and calls her the foundation of this Lady Lions team. "This program would not be where they are today without U'llyriah," DuBois said. "She started when she was a ninth grader and she first played for me in the sixth grade when I was coaching in a recreational league. It's a special bond between U'llyriah and I, and she has helped put this program on the map." In seventh and eighth grade Lewis suffered back-to-back torn ACLs in both of her knees. When DuBois began coaching Prattville, the two rekindled and have flourished together in the past four seasons. Lewis talked about the impact DuBois had on her basketball journey and how from day one she always believed in her talents. "From the beginning when I came in my freshman year with two braces on, she told me I have to get out of it and that it's only a mental thing," Lewis said. "She is a great coach, being with her has taught me to be tougher than I am. She does not just teach players how to play the game but teaches us how to apply these skills to the real world. She is like a mother to me, and I love her." With more than half of the roster retuning next year, Dubois says the future is bright for the Lady Lions. The backcourt duo of Jayla West-Young and Keleigh Mullens were vital pieces to this postseason run and will get another shot at it next season. When asked about their offseason plans, they collectively agreed that they will be putting in the work preparing for next season. "The future looks bright for this program," Dubois said. "We will still be the same family that got us here this year and we have a lot of girls returning." Jerry Humphrey III is a sports writer for the Montgomery Advertiser who covers area high school sports, Auburn recruiting and Alabama State athletics. Follow him on Twitter @jerryhump3.

author: Cécile Soulé
title: Météo : treize départements en vigilance orange canicule, trois départements en orange pour crues - France Bleu
text: Météo : treize départements en vigilance orange canicule, trois départements en orange pour crues Treize départements restent en vigilance orange canicule ce vendredi et trois départements sont placés en vigilance orange aux crues. 13 départements du quart Sud-Est restent en vigilance orange pour canicule. Il s'agit des Alpes-de-Haute-Provence, des Alpes-Maritimes, de l'Ardèche, des Bouches-du-Rhône, de la Corse-du-Sud, de la Haute-Corse, de la Drôme, du Gard, de l'Hérault, de l'Isère, du Rhône, du Var et du Vaucluse. Les minimales de ce vendredi matin seront encore très élevées près de la Méditerranée, comprises entre 22 et 26°C, et resteront élevées en journée, avec 35 à 39°C. Trois départements sont également placés en vigilance orange aux crues : la Meurthe-et-Moselle, la Seine-et-Marne et les Vosges. Des orages violents et de fortes pluies ont provoqué encore de gros dégâts dans les Vosges dans la nuit de jeudi à vendredi, [dans le secteur de Dompaire](https://www.francebleu.fr/infos/meteo/en-images-d-importantes-inondations-apres-un-violent-orage-dans-le-secteur-de-dompaire-dans-les-vosges-6047549). Sur la petite commune de Damas-et-Bettegney, une dizaine de personnes ont été relogées. Une cellule de crise a été activée. L'info en continu Les plus consultés Disparition de Lina : stupéfaction dans le quartier de Besançon où vivait un potentiel suspect [France Bleu Besançon](/besancon) Disparition de Laure Zacchello au Pays basque : la justice donne la garde des enfants aux grands-parents maternels [France Bleu Pays Basque](/pays-basque) Au Pays Basque, une clôture de barbelés posée en travers d'un sentier de VTT, "à hauteur de cou d'homme" [France Bleu Pays Basque](/pays-basque)

author: Osobe Waberi
title: 300 Canadian Muslim groups say members of Parliament aren’t welcome in their religious spaces ahead of Ramadan unless they call for a ceasefire in Gaza - NOW Toronto
text: Hundreds of Muslim institutions and mosques across Canada have penned an open letter letting federal government officials know they are not welcome in their spaces ahead of Ramadan unless they condemn the Israel-Gaza war. The joint call, spearheaded by the National Council of Canadian Muslims (NCCM), is asking the federal government to help the innocent Palestinian civilians being killed in Gaza, especially ahead of the upcoming Muslim holiday. “The Muslim community throughout our country is deeply affected by the loss of all innocent life, including the tens of thousands of our brothers and sisters in Gaza who have fallen victim to the collective punishment imposed upon them by the Netanyahu government,” the letter [reads](https://www.nccm.ca/ramadan2024/). “Millions more are at risk of death due to indiscriminate bombardment, the targeting of hospitals, systematic starvation, and the proposed military operation in Rafah that Canada, Australia and New Zealand have said would be catastrophic,” it continued. According to [The New York Times](https://www.nytimes.com/2024/02/22/world/middleeast/gaza-death-toll-israel.html), 29,000 Palestinians have been killed in the war since October 7, 2023, most of whom are women and children. The call to action also states that places of worship have always welcomed elected MPs from all parties during Ramadan to connect with Canadian Muslims, but this time is different. “As our hearts break for the people of Palestine, we renew our commitment to upholding the ethics of our sacred month,” the letter said. In fact, these groups are asking politicians to commit to a list of demands before they can be welcomed in mosques again. FIVE DEMANDS TO MPS - Condemning the war crimes being committed by Israeli forces; - Supporting an immediate ceasefire urgently needed to protect civilians sheltering in Rafah and beyond; - Demanding the immediate resumption of funding for UNRWA, a lifeline for millions of refugees which was suspended without reasonable basis; - Opposing the flow of arms and military equipment to the Netanyahu government, which, as confirmed by the ICJ, is engaged in plausible genocide; and - Standing in defence of civil liberties, including the right of Canadians to express solidarity with the Palestinian people without fear of reprisal. Prime Minister Justin Trudeau has since weighed in on the letter. “I’m going to continue to visit with Canadians right across the country to engage with communities, particularly the Muslim community that is hurting because of what’s going on on the other side of the world,” he [told CBC’s](https://www.cbc.ca/news/politics/muslim-mps-gaza-unrwa-1.7121789) Wendy Bergfelt on Mainstreet Cape Breton. The letter also comes after Trudeau was booed by worshippers both inside and outside a mosque last year. Ramadan’s official start date is Mar. 10 and ends on Apr. 9.

author: Joel Martin / Columbia Basin Herald (TNS)
title: Seniors save on fishing in Washington state
text: A day on the water with a pole and peace and quiet may just be what the doctor ordered, even if you have to wear some mittens as temps decline. Seniors wanting to cast a line in Washington are in luck; licenses are significantly discounted for people over the age of 70. Washington offers several license options, according to the Department of Fish and Wildlife. The Annual Freshwater License is the most useful here in the Columbia Basin, where the nearest salt water is more than 100 miles away. This license covers all inland waters, including the Columbia River and its tributaries. For folks who can get to the west side easily, the Annual Saltwater License is for anglers who love the challenge of coastal and Puget Sound fishing, according to the WSFW. This includes fishing in marine areas and for salmon and steelhead in saltwater. For those who like to spend their time at the beach, the Shellfish/Seaweed license covers clams, mussels, oysters, and seaweed collection. And then there's an Annual Combination License, which covers all three. This is where the savings come in, according to the WDFW. For most Washington residents, the Annual Freshwater License is $29.50 per year. For seniors 70 and up, it's only $7.50. The other licenses are similarly affordable for seniors. The Annual Saltwater License is $8.05 for seniors compared to $30.05 for everyone else, and the Combination License is only $19.05 for seniors versus the standard adult fee of $55.35. Acquiring a senior license is easy. They're available online at fishhunt.dfw.wa.gov, by phone at 360-902-2464 or at any business that sells licenses. Ordering online or by phone can mean a delay of up to 10 days, the WDFW wrote, but they'll email a temporary license to use until the regular one arrives. The WDFW offers some tips for seniors to get the most out of their fishing trip: —Explore new waters: Use the money saved on your license to visit different fishing spots across the state. Washington boasts over 7,000 lakes and 70,000 miles of rivers and streams, offering endless exploration opportunities. —Invest in quality gear: Put the savings towards that high-end rod or reel you've always wanted. Many tackle shops offer senior discounts, so be sure to ask. —Attend fishing clinics: WDFW regularly hosts fishing clinics, some specifically designed for seniors. These events can help you brush up on skills or learn new techniques. —Consider guided trips: With the money saved on licenses, treat yourself to a guided fishing trip. Many guides offer senior discounts and can provide access to prime fishing spots you might not discover on your own. —Fish during off-peak times: As a senior, you likely have more flexible schedules. Take advantage of this by fishing during weekdays or off-seasons when the waters are less crowded. More information can be found at wdfw.wa.gov. ___ (c)2024 the Columbia Basin Herald, Wash. Visit the Columbia Basin Herald, Wash. at www.columbiabasinherald.com Distributed by Tribune Content Agency, LLC.
